contextId.occurrenceNote: The Israelites drew lots to decide where people would live. Alternate translation: "Kohathites. The first lot that they drew was theirs" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Kohathites (the first lot was theirs)

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that these men were Israelite soldiers. Alternate translation: "The whole army of Israel ran away from the Philistines" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Every man of Israel fled from before the Philistines and fell down dead on Mount Gilboa

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase means that both the leaders of David's army, and the full army, helped David to establish himself as king over Israel. Alternate translation: "who strongly supported David's kingdom ... to make him king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom ... to make him king

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that he poured out the water as an offering to Yahweh. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: he poured it out to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This compares the size of the spear with the size of a weaver's beam. Alternate translation: "a spear the size of a weaver's beam" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: a spear like a weaver's beam

contextId.occurrenceNote: What God will see may be supplied in translation. Alternate translation: "may the God of our ancestors see what you intend to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: may the God of our ancestors see

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implicit that they would give loyalty to David. Alternate translation: "ready to give undivided loyalty to David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: ready to give undivided loyalty

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to all of the Israelites who were assembled in this place. Alternate translation: "all of the Israelites who were assembled there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: all the assembly of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that they are taking the ark to Jerusalem. Alternate translation: "to take to Jerusalem the ark of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: to bring up from there the ark of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: You may need to make explicit that the cherubim are those on the lid of the ark of the covenant. The biblical writers often spoke of the ark of the covenant as if it were Yahweh's footstool upon which he rested his feet as he sat on his throne in heaven above. Alternate translation: "who sits on his throne above the cherubim on the ark of the covenant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: who sits enthroned over the cherubim

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that David led his army out to fight against them. Alternate translation: "led his army out to fight against them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: went out against them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "gatekeepers" refers to people who guard gates or entryways. Here it refers to guarding access to the ark of the covenant and applies to Obed Edom and Jeiel. Alternate translation: "Mikneiah, and the gatekeepers, Obed Edom and Jeiel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Mikneiah, Obed Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is implied that "the land" refers to Canaan. Alternate translation: "foreigners in the land of Canaan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: strangers in the land

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that the people were to bow down in worship. Alternate translation: "Bow down to worship Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/translate-symaction]])
contextId.glQuote: Bow down to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that this refers to all the creatures living in the sea. They are spoken of as if they should shout with joy like people might do. Alternate translation: "the sea creatures shout joyfully" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: that which fills it shout with joy

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that they were to perform the daily duties that were given in the law of Yahweh. Alternate translation: "as was required every day by the law" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: as every day's work required

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that they were to guard the entrance to the tabernacle. Alternate translation: "guarded the tabernacle gate" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: guarded the gate

contextId.occurrenceNote: Cedar is a kind of tree that is known for its strength. If you have an equivalent type of tree in your culture, you can use that name, otherwise you can reword this. Alternate translation: "I am living in a strong, permanent house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I am living in a house of cedar

contextId.occurrenceNote: Tents are temporary dwellings. If you do not have tents in your culture, you can word this differently. Alternate translation: "the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is staying in a temporary place" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is staying under a tent

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that this refers to God bringing up Israel out of the land of Egypt. Alternate translation: "that I brought the Israelites to the promised land from the land of Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: that I brought up Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The implied information is that they were rescued from slavery. Alternate translation: "you rescued from slavery in Egypt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you rescued from Egypt

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is understood from David's command in [1 Chronicles 21:2](../21/02.md) that Joab went to count the people of Israel. It can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "So Joab left and went throughout all Israel to count the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: So Joab left and went throughout all Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The one who sent him was Yahweh. This can be stated explicitly. Alternate translation: "I should take to Yahweh who sent me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: I should take to the one who sent me

contextId.occurrenceNote: They were afraid of the angel. This can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "hid themselves because they were afraid of the angel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: hid themselves

contextId.occurrenceNote: This implies that David should take the land without paying for it. Alternate translation: "Take it as a gift" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Take it as your own

contextId.occurrenceNote: The name "Solomon" sounds like the Hebrew word for "peace." This can be made explicit. Alternate translation: "His name will be Solomon, which sounds like the word for peace" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: For his name will be Solomon

contextId.occurrenceNote: For all of the other people in the list, the text specifies that there were "twelve persons in number." Since this was likely true for Joseph's family also, you may want to state it clearly. Alternate translation: "The first lot fell to Joseph's family, twelve persons in number" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: The first lot fell to Joseph's family

contextId.occurrenceNote: These were his relatives who did this work with him. Alternate translation: "His relatives who did the work with him from the clan of Eliezer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: His relatives from the clan of Eliezer

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here David is giving a command to all of the people of Israel. Alternate translation: "Now then, in the sight of all Israel, this assembly for Yahweh, and in the presence of our God, I command all of you to" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Now then, in the sight of all Israel ... all of you must

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the detail for the design of the temple. Alternate translation: "helped me to understand the details for his temple" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: gave me to understand regarding the design

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "Israel" refers to the man Jacob. Alternate translation: "Jacob our ancestor" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: Israel our ancestor

contextId.occurrenceNote: To do something with "Yahweh's authority" means to do it on his behalf and with his approval. Alternate translation: "anointed him to rule over Israel on Yahweh's behalf" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: anointed him with Yahweh's authority to be ruler

contextId.occurrenceNote: "all the things that happened to him and to the people of Israel and in the kingdoms of other countries while he was ruling Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: the events that affected him, Israel, and all the kingdoms of the other lands
